decision tree.content: Evaluation of a patient with flatulence

children.content: Obtain patient history and perform physical examination. If stools are loose, examine for ova, parasites, leukocytes, and bacterial pathogens.
Eliminate offending agents such as lactose, legumes, cabbage from the diet

children.node: Sigmoidoscopy and Barium Enema or Colonoscopy
children.content: Perform sigmoidoscopy and barium enema or colonoscopy to look for anorectal disease and colonic disorders
Normal results from sigmoidoscopy and barium enema or colonoscopy

children.node: Consider: Upper GI and small bowel x-ray series, Abdominal ultrasonography
children.content: Consider performing upper GI and small bowel x-ray series and abdominal ultrasonography
Normal results from upper GI and small bowel x-ray series and abdominal ultrasonography

children.node: Consider: Gut motility testing or hydrogen breath testing
children.content: Consider performing gut motility testing or hydrogen breath testing

children.node: Consider: Treatment with bulking agents, antispasmodics, or stress reduction
children.content: Consider treatment with bulking agents, antispasmodics, or stress reduction
Abnormal results from upper GI and small bowel x-ray series and abdominal ultrasonography
Abnormal results from sigmoidoscopy and barium enema or colonoscopy
Treat based on the identified ova, parasites, leukocytes, or bacterial pathogens
